gurmukhi: BwNiq BwNiqn swj dY brbwj Aau gjrwj ] Awpny kIno niRpM sB pwrsY mhw rwj ]
transliteration: Bhaant(i) Bhaantin Saaj Dai Barbaaj Au Gadraaj|| Aapane Keeno Nripan Sabh Paarsai Mahaa Raaj||
translation: Persenting various types of elephants and horses, Parasnth achieved the nearness of all of them;

gurmukhi: lwl jwl pÍwl ibdRm hIr cIr AnMq ] l`c l`C sÍrx isM|I idj eyk eyk imlMq ]
transliteration: Laal Jaal Pravaal Bidram Heer Cheer Anant|| Lachchh Lachchh Svaran Singidij Eke K Milant||
translation: To every Brahmin, he gave in charity rubies, pearls, diamonds, gems, garments gold etc.;

gurmukhi: moih BUpiq BUim kY iek kIn j`g bjwie ] BwNiq BwNiq sBw bnwies bYT BUpiq Awie ]19]93]
transliteration: Moh(i) Bhoopat(i) Bhoom(i) Kai Ik Keen Jagg Bajaae|| Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Sabhaa Banaaes Baith Bhoopat(i) Aae||19||93||
translation: Then the king arranged a Yajna, in which various kings participated.1993.

gurmukhi: iek idn bYTy sBw bnweI ] bfy bfy CqRI bsuDw ky lIny inkit bulweI ]
transliteration: Ik Din Baithe Sabhaa Banaaee|| Bade Bade Chhatribasudhaa Ke Leene Nikattee Bulaaee||
translation: One day, the king held his court, wherein he had invited the chief kings of the earth;

gurmukhi: Aru jy huqy dys dysn mY qy BI srb bulwey ] suin ieh BwNiq srb jtDwrI dys dys qy Awey ]
transliteration: Ar(u) Je Houte Des Desan Mai Te Bhisarab Bulaae|| Soun(i) Eh Bhaant(i) Sarab Jatdhaarides Des Te Aae||
translation: Other people of various countries were also called; all the hermits with matted locks and the Yogic reached there;

gurmukhi: nwnw BwNiq jtn kh Dwry Aru muK ibBUq lgwey ] blkl AMg dIrG nK soBq miRgpq dyK ljwey ]
transliteration: Naanaa Bhaant(i) Jatan Kah Dhdare Ar(u) Moukh Bibhoot Lagade|| Balkal An Dtragh Nakh Sobhat Mripat Dekh Lajaae||
translation: All of them had grown matted locks of various kinds and smeared ashes of their faces; they had worn the ochrecoloured clothes on their limbs; seeing their long nails, even the lions were feeling shy;

gurmukhi: muMdRq nyqR aUrD kr Epq prm kwCnI kwCy ] ins idn jpXo krq d`qw qRY mhw munISr AwCy ]20]94]
transliteration: Mounndrat Netra Ooradh Kar Opat Param Kaadhhanikaadhhe|| Nis Din Japyo Karat Dattaa Trai Mahaa Mounndeshar Aachhe||20||94||
translation: They were the performers of Supreme austerities by closing their eyes and raising their hands; they remembered the sage Dattatreya day and night.20.94.

gurmukhi: kY qum hm ko prcO idKwE ] nwqr ijqy qum ho jtDwrI sBhI jtw muMfwE ]
transliteration: Kai Toum Ham Ko Parchau Dikhaao|| Naatar Jite Toum Ho Jatdhaarisabh-hijataa Muaaeeaao||
translation: Either all of you may give me cognizance of your yoga or shave off your matted locks;

gurmukhi: jogI jogu jtn ky BIqr jykr kCUAk hoeI ] qau hir DXwn Coir dr dr qy CIK n mwNgY koeI ]
transliteration: Jogijog(u) Jatan Ke Bheetar Jekat Kachhodhak Hoee|| Tau Har(i) Dhyaan Chhodh(i) Dar Te Bheekh Na Maanad Koee||
translation: O Yogis ! if there had been some secret of Yoga in the matted locks, then any Yogi would not have gone for begging at different doors instead of absorbing in meditation on the Lord;
